content:
• Thursday, July 5, 2012
  • LF

    LeapFrog (NYSE:LF) -5.5% AH after announcing CFO Mark A. Etnyre is resigning effective Oct. 1 to...

    LeapFrog (NYSE:LF) -5.5% AH after announcing CFO Mark A. Etnyre is resigning effective Oct. 1 to "spend more time with his family and pursue personal interests." No replacement is named. LeapFrog shares had rallied today on positive buzz related to new children's learning products.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) -5.9% AH after warning it expects FQ4 revenue of $4.5B, below a consensus...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) -5.9% AH after warning it expects FQ4 revenue of $4.5B, below a consensus of $4.9B. Gross margin is expected to be 33.6%, below prior guidance of at least 34.5%. The company blames a failure to achieve share gains due to a faster-than-expected industry recovery from Thai flooding, and a "supplier quality issue" that affected enterprise hard drive shipments by 1.5M. Several analysts issued cautious notes last week. WDC -4.5% in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • XRTX

    More on Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ2 beats on EPS but comes up slightly short on revenue as total...

    More on Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ2 beats on EPS but comes up slightly short on revenue as total sales slipped 4.8% Y/Y. Gross profit margin was a key driver in its earnings beat, coming in at 16.5%, compared to 12.9% in the same period last year. The increase was driven by better performance from its HDD Capital Equipment products unit, which had been impacted by significantly reduced revenue and specific inventory provisions in the prior year. Shares +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) has resumed trading following its giant Q2 warning. Shares are down...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) has resumed trading following its giant Q2 warning. Shares are down 26.2%. Some of Informatica's more volatile enterprise software peers also aren't taking the news well. QLIK -3.2%. MSTR -1.4%.  RHT -1.1%. VMW -1.2%. CTXS -1.4%. CRM -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • GNK

    Dry bulk shipping stocks showed strong gains, led by Genco (GNK +12.3%) and DryShips (DRYS...

    Dry bulk shipping stocks showed strong gains, led by Genco (GNK +12.3%) and DryShips (DRYS +8.7%) as capesize shipping rates have doubled to $7,569/day since Friday. The Baltic Dry Index is up 15% since Friday following recent developments in Europe; many dry bulk shippers are based out of Greece.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) warns it expects Q2 revenue of $188M-$190M and EPS of $0.27-$0.28,...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) warns it expects Q2 revenue of $188M-$190M and EPS of $0.27-$0.28, well below a consensus of $217.2M and $0.37. Informatica, which had already issued disappointing Q2 guidance, only blames macro issues centered around Europe. The data warehousing software vendor also says it's implementing a new $100M stock buyback, and that Worldwide Field Operations chief  Paul Hoffman will retire by year's end. Shares are halted, and will resume trading at 4:45 PM ET.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): Q2 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $322.1M (-4.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): Q2 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $322.1M (-4.8% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares +8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC -2.2%) shares slide in response to an update from Tullow, its partner in...

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC -2.2%) shares slide in response to an update from Tullow, its partner in Ghana, on the offshore Jubilee oil field. Tullow cut the upper end of its 2012 projected Jubilee production figure to 80K bbl/day from 90K. Tudor Pickering Holt cuts 2013 production targets for APC by 0.5% and Kosmos Energy (KOS -3.7%), which owns a stake in Jubilee, by 13%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +1.8%) Indonesian unit is considering an IPO in a move analysts say may...

    Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +1.8%) Indonesian unit is considering an IPO in a move analysts say may be a way to manage the impact of the country's new rules limiting foreign ownership in mines. Freeport Indonesia operates the Grasberg mine on Papua island that holds the largest gold reserves and is the second-largest copper mine in the world.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • ISCA

    Shares of International Speedway (ISCA +2.9%) gain after the company easily beat the estimates...

    Shares of International Speedway (ISCA +2.9%) gain after the company easily beat the estimates of analysts with its Q2 report. The firm maintained its full-year guidance numbers, but warns that a slumping economy is hurting attendance figures for NASCAR races.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • RSH

    Shares of electronic sellers RadioShack (RSH +5.4%), hhgregg (HGG +1.6%), and Conn's (CONN...

    Shares of electronic sellers RadioShack (RSH +5.4%), hhgregg (HGG +1.6%), and Conn's (CONN +3.8%) trade higher as the ongoing drama at Best Buy continues to raise the M&A profile of the group. With margins razor-thin, the upcoming back-to-school season is also being counted on by the firms as a big part of their turnaround plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    The sudden rise in Neflix (NFLX +13.5%), up over 19% for the week, is starting to look overdone...

    The sudden rise in Neflix (NFLX +13.5%), up over 19% for the week, is starting to look overdone to a horde of skeptics. The question of the day on NFLX: Does an anecdotal Facebook post about streaming hours translate into paid subscriber growth?
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • PCXCQ

    Coal stocks (KOL +1.7%) are making a comeback, adding to Tuesday's sharp gains as strong foreign...

    Coal stocks (KOL +1.7%) are making a comeback, adding to Tuesday's sharp gains as strong foreign demand for coal raises prospects for the industry. Patriot Coal (PCX +38%) has jumped more than 80% in the last three trading sessions, but shares are still only one-tenth of their 52-week high. JRCC +19.1%, ANR +3.8%, ACI +2.7%, BTU +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (MT -4%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at HSBC Securities with...

    ArcelorMittal (MT -4%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at HSBC Securities with an $18.30 target price, as the firm notes financial fears have evaporated but business conditions continue to deteriorate. The firm cuts its estimated 2012 EBITDA for the steel company by another 10% and expects consensus to follow.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold (EGO -3.9%) says Greece's top court ordered a suspension of all tree-cutting...

    Eldorado Gold (EGO -3.9%) says Greece's top court ordered a suspension of all tree-cutting activities in a company-owned forest area in Halkidiki, where EGO has a 100% interest in the Stratoni Mine as well as interests in the Olympias and Skouries projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM -10%) is downgraded by Raymond James to Market Perform, as the firm says the...

    Solazyme (SZYM -10%) is downgraded by Raymond James to Market Perform, as the firm says the stock's risk/reward profile has become less attractive after a recent run-up. The firm says the versatility of SZYM's algae-produced oils opens the door to a wide range of opportunities, but the stock is likely to continue to be prone to sharp up-and-down swings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +4.2%) and Deckers (DECK +6.3%) both trade higher with some signs pointing...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +4.2%) and Deckers (DECK +6.3%) both trade higher with some signs pointing to a bit of a short squeeze in play this week. Both companies have been bandied about as too reliant on their signature products, but signs point to a wider product mix starting to percolate for the pair.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +7.6%) soars to levels last seen in early April, as speculation grows that Apple...

    Yelp (YELP +7.6%) soars to levels last seen in early April, as speculation grows that Apple plans to integrate Yelp's check-in feature for points of interest within its new mapping software (previous), which will accompany iOS 6. There's no word on whether Foursquare or Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) check-in features will also be integrated.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 2 Comments

  • Lake Shore Gold (LSG +11.8%) reports Q2 gold production of 24,426 oz. with 183,215 metric tons...

    Lake Shore Gold (LSG +11.8%) reports Q2 gold production of 24,426 oz. with 183,215 metric tons milled at average grade of 4.3 grams/tonne. LSG says it remains on track to achieve its target of 85K-100K oz. of gold poured in 2012 and to exit the year positioned for strong production growth in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +3.2%) is bouncing a little today. The rally comes in spite of reports...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +3.2%) is bouncing a little today. The rally comes in spite of reports carriers such as AT&T and Verizon are pressuring RIM to lower the BlackBerry Internet Service (BIS) fees it charges for its 78M subscribers. BIS accounts for over a third of RIM's revenue, and is a needed source of profit as hardware losses accelerate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 3 Comments
  • HUSA

    Houston American Energy (HUSA -21.2%) shares plunge after the company says its Cachirre #1 well...

    Houston American Energy (HUSA -21.2%) shares plunge after the company says its Cachirre #1 well was unable to produce oil during swab tests and thus will be plugged and abandoned.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment

  • It's always a good idea to check the grains after July 4, and they're soaring again as no relief...

    It's always a good idea to check the grains after July 4, and they're soaring again as no relief is in sight from the heat and drought. Adding fuel is the Ukraine, which lowered its corn crop estimate by 8% due to its own weather issues. A couple of headlines for the contrarians: "Corn is shining like gold," and "New dust bowl days on the horizon." CORN +2.5%, JJG +2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • LF

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF +11.4%) soar on heavy volume after its new products continue to generate...

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF +11.4%) soar on heavy volume after its new products continue to generate quite a bit of buzz. Though the iPad and other mobile devices were viewed as potentially denting sales for the company, its education-focused devices without Internet access are proving to fill a void in the electronics toy market for parents.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVP

    Avon Products (AVP +2.4%) moves higher this morning on a report that it's filed a form 8k with...

    Avon Products (AVP +2.4%) moves higher this morning on a report that it's filed a form 8k with the SEC in regards to taking out a line of credit for up to $750M dollars, with access to $500M immediately. SA contributor Scott Matusow says the company already has enough cash on hand for day-to-day operations, and thinks it may be on the hunt for an acquisition. One potential target: Obagi Medical Devices (OMPI +3.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • ENG

    ENGlobal (ENG +13%) shares surge after the provider of engineering and professional services to...

    ENGlobal (ENG +13%) shares surge after the provider of engineering and professional services to the energy sector says it is one of three firms awarded a multiple award contract estimated at $215M for the procurement of automated fuel handling equipment support services to the U.S. military.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • CHU

    China Unicom (CHU +7.1%) soars after HSBC upgrades the company to Neutral. The firm declares...

    China Unicom (CHU +7.1%) soars after HSBC upgrades the company to Neutral. The firm declares China's #2 mobile carrier to have an increasingly attractive valuation, following its recent selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX +2.8%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. As of Tuesday's close,...

    Yandex (YNDX +2.8%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. As of Tuesday's close, shares of the Russian search giant had fallen roughly 30% from their April highs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • LB

    The retail sector (XRT +0.5%) ratchets higher after the dust settles from a flood of June sales...

    The retail sector (XRT +0.5%) ratchets higher after the dust settles from a flood of June sales reports. Investor favorites of the day include Limited (LTD +5.5%) and TJX Companies (TJX +3.5%), with both companies raising their profit outlooks (I, II). Kohl's (KSS +5.3%) is showing surprising strength off its sales miss, but a comment from the department store operator tipping off that sales trends improved over the course over the month is holding sway

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD -3.5%) trade lower after the drugstore chain reports that same-store...

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD -3.5%) trade lower after the drugstore chain reports that same-store sales fell 1% in June. While the prescription count was up for the month, lower-priced generics negatively impacted results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +8.5%) extends Tuesday's rally as bulls go long and bears cover following positive...

    Netflix (NFLX +8.5%) extends Tuesday's rally as bulls go long and bears cover following positive sell-side commentary, and a Facebook post from Reed Hastings claiming Netflix's monthly viewing topped 1B hours in June. BTIG's Richard Greenfield estimates this translates into 80 minutes of viewing per subscriber, a level that puts Netflix on par with leading cable networks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • NVAX

    Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) provides a positive report from the Phase I trial of what would be the...

    Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) provides a positive report from the Phase I trial of what would be the first vaccine for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), which causes pneumonia, as well as bronchiolitis in babies. Shares -3.5% but they've been rising since the middle of June. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • AMD

    AMD falls 3.1% thanks to a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee, which is slashing its PT to...

    AMD falls 3.1% thanks to a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee, which is slashing its PT to $8.50 from $10. The firm is worried about slowing PC demand, and ultrabook and tablet competition. AMD's Q2 report arrives on July 19.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 3 Comments
  • AVL

    Avalon Rare Metals (AVL +3.6%) shares jump on late Tuesday's news that the company bought out...

    Avalon Rare Metals (AVL +3.6%) shares jump on late Tuesday's news that the company bought out the 3% Calabras/Lutoda Net Smelter Return royalty on its Thor Lake property in the Northwest Territories for $2M. Thor Lake encompasses AVL's flagship Nechalacho Rare Earth Elements Deposit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • VEOEY

    Veolia Environment (VE -8.4%) tumbles after a downgrade to Sell from UBS. The move is helping to...

    Veolia Environment (VE -8.4%) tumbles after a downgrade to Sell from UBS. The move is helping to drag down the water ETF (PHO -0.7%) as Veolia makes up 4.22% of the fund's holdings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • CTRX

    Credit Suisse reiterates its "outperform" rating on SXC Health Solutions (SXCI +4.1%) and says...

    Credit Suisse reiterates its "outperform" rating on SXC Health Solutions (SXCI +4.1%) and says the next major catalyst for the company will be its earnings forecasts in its Q2 results. The vote of confidence comes after shareholders approved SXC's merger with Catalyst Health Solutions (NASDAQ:CHSI) on Monday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH) +4.1% premarket following word late Tuesday that the healthcare revenue...

    Accretive Health (AH) +4.1% premarket following word late Tuesday that the healthcare revenue manager expects to reach a new five-year deal with Ascension Health by month’s end. Baird believes the deal, though “largely expected," removes a longstanding overhang on AH shares; Oppenheimer reiterates its Outperform rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • KSS

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) reports same-stores sales fell off a sharp 4.2% in June despite the uptick in...

    Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) reports same-stores sales fell off a sharp 4.2% in June despite the uptick in sales it saw in the last part of the month. As a result of the performance, the company now expects Q2 EPS to fall in the low end of its previously-announced range of $0.96-$1.02. Shares +1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • HDSN

    Hudson Technologies (NASDAQ:HDSN) +9.1% premarket after disclosing plans to sell up to 1.17M...

    Hudson Technologies (NASDAQ:HDSN) +9.1% premarket after disclosing plans to sell up to 1.17M shares, as the refrigerant services company seeks to raise general funds.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • OSUR

    OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR) +4.9% premarket after Tuesday's news that its home HIV test...

    OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR) +4.9% premarket after Tuesday's news that its home HIV test was approved by the FDA. The OraQuick In-Home HIV test has been available to healthcare professionals, but the company officials say the test will be available in October at retailers, large supermarket and drugstore chains, and online.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • BKE

    Shares of Buckle (NYSE:BKE) trade 6.6% lower premarket after the company reported slumping sales...

    Shares of Buckle (NYSE:BKE) trade 6.6% lower premarket after the company reported slumping sales for June. It's the first time in over 30 months that the specialty retailer has posted a negative growth number for the key metric.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures are mixed and oscillating above and below zero, with the S&P...

    Market preview: Stock futures are mixed and oscillating above and below zero, with the S&P benchmark +0.2%, while EU shares are lower. It's not the usual reaction to decent jobs figures (I, II) and three central banks easing on the same day (I, II, III), although none of the actions are much of a surprise, except maybe that the PBOC decided to ease today. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, ISM Non-Manufacturing Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • PCXCQ

    Premarket gainers: PCX +11%. NSPH +5%. SXCI +5%. OSUR +5%. Losers: BKE -7%. VE -7%. BBVA -5%.

    Premarket gainers: PCX +11%. NSPH +5%. SXCI +5%. OSUR +5%.
    Losers: BKE -7%. VE -7%. BBVA -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ROST

    Shares of Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) trade 2.7% higher premarket after the retailer comes in with...

    Shares of Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) trade 2.7% higher premarket after the retailer comes in with one of the most solid June same-store sale reports amongst a worrisome group of numbers piling in for the sector. It's more evidence that the discounters trade may be the best bet in retail for the time being.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • TGT

    Shares of Target (NYSE:TGT) slump 2.2% lower premarket after the company reports June sales in...

    Shares of Target (NYSE:TGT) slump 2.2% lower premarket after the company reports June sales in the low end of its forecast. The retailer backed its previously issued guidance for Q2, but analysts seem wary that Target may need to shifts its estimates lower fairly shortly.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX) -1.6% premarket after Argentina’s Supreme Court ruled to remove...

    Barrick Gold (ABX) -1.6% premarket after Argentina’s Supreme Court ruled to remove injunctions that have blocked key parts of a law to protect glaciers, a legal reversal that may affect development of its Pascua-Lama project on the border between Argentina and Chile. Shares fell 1.6% yesterday in Toronto trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • ROST

    Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) same-store sales: +7.0% beats consensus of +4.8%. Total sales +12.0%...

    Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) same-store sales: +7.0% beats consensus of +4.8%. Total sales +12.0% to $886M. Shares +1.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • TJX

    TJX (NYSE:TJX) same-store sales: +7.0% beats consensus of +4.2%. Shares +1.9% premarket. Total...

    TJX (NYSE:TJX) same-store sales: +7.0% beats consensus of +4.2%. Shares +1.9% premarket. Total sales +9% to $2.1B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM

  • The big beat from the ADP jobs print gives a boost to S&P futures, now +0.3% after dipping...

    The big beat from the ADP jobs print gives a boost to S&P futures, now +0.3% after dipping into the red just ahead of the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO) prepares to shut down production on the Norwegian continental shelf following a...

    Statoil (STO) prepares to shut down production on the Norwegian continental shelf following a notice of lockout from the Norwegian Oil Industry Association to take effect Monday and be imposed on all members of striking unions. The leader of the SAFE trade union says the unions are prepared to strike for "weeks." Brent crude +2.1% to $101.90. STO -3.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 3 Comments
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) same-store sales: +2.1% misses consensus of +2.4%. Shares -3.3% premarket....

    Target (NYSE:TGT) same-store sales: +2.1% misses consensus of +2.4%. Shares -3.3% premarket. Total sales +2.6% to 6.41B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM

  • Gold can't hold onto gains despite monetary spigots opening everywhere, falling especially...

    Gold can't hold onto gains despite monetary spigots opening everywhere, falling especially quickly following the timid move by the ECB, now -0.5% to $1,612.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 5 Comments
  • ANH

    Anworth Mortgage (NYSE:ANH) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at B. Riley, which also cuts its...

    Anworth Mortgage (NYSE:ANH) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at B. Riley, which also cuts its price target to $7 (current price $6.93). The analyst says the flat yield curve and higher prepayment speeds are going to hurt earnings. Shares -3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 1 Comment

  • Showing little reaction to the BoE's widely expected additional QE, stock futures move higher on...

    Showing little reaction to the BoE's widely expected additional QE, stock futures move higher on the PBOC's somewhat unexpected rate cut. S&P 500 +0.3%. The aussie gets its tail in the air, +0.3% to $1.0302.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
